name: json-to-go
description: Convert JSON data to Go type definition

json-to-go.allOmitEmpty.description: When enabled will add omitempty to all JSON tags

json-to-go.autoSelectTypeName.description: When enabled and output is temporary file automatically selects the type name after converting

json-to-go.generatedTypeName.description: Type name in the generated output

json-to-go.inlineTypeDefinitions.description: When enabled nested structs are defined inline, otherwise below the main struct

json-to-go.contextMenu.supportedLanguage.description: Editor languages inside for which right mouse context menu entry is shown. Include "*" for all languages.

json-to-go.io.input.description: Source of JSON data to convert. Can be either clipboard or selection in active editor
enumDescriptions: JSON data is copied from clipboard and converted
JSON data is copied from active editor selection and converted
User is asked every time to select source of JSON data

json-to-go.io.output.description: Destination of struct definition string. Can be either clipboard, inserted after cursor position in active editor or temporary file
enumDescriptions: Outputs struct after cursor position in active editor
Opens temporary file with struct definition and selects name of the struct
User is asked every time to select destination of struct definition

json-to-go.pasteIntegration.enabled.description: When enabled JSON to Go will intercept paste events and transform pasted text to a Go type definition (if editor language is inside the configured array and the text is valid JSON)

json-to-go.pasteIntegration.supportedLan.description: Editor languages inside which to intercept paste events. Only Go by default, you can include "*" for all languages but it is not recommended.
